name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. Norma Mae OAKIE, Appellant

judges: Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX, MANDERINO and PACKEL, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. Norma Mae OAKIE, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION
PER CURIAM:
The record is remanded to the trial court for an evidentiary hearing and for a determination of the truthfulness of the appellant’s statement that she was “led to believe” by her trial counsel that she was pleading guilty to “involuntary manslaughter.”
If the trial court concludes the appellant was misled, as she states, permission should be granted to withdraw the guilty plea. On the other hand, if the trial court concludes the appellant was not misled the court’s findings and conclusions should be reported to this Court.
It is so ordered.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Steven H. Goldblatt, Asst. Dist. Atty., Chief, Appeals Div., for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
378 A.2d 313
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. Norma Mae OAKIE, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Jan. 10, 1977.
Decided Oct. 7, 1977.
Harry Schwartz, Philadelphia, for appellant.
F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Steven H. Goldblatt, Asst. Dist. Atty., Chief, Appeals Div., for appellee.
Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX, MANDERINO and PACKEL, JJ.
